Based on the preferences and cues you provided, here are two movie recommendations that might suit your taste:

  * "The Secret Garden" (1911) ) stars AJ Cross as Peter Sebastian, a lone spy who must face a global threat that may wreak havoc upon all Americans. Peter must act fast to stop the terrorists before they are able to carry out their devious plan. Will Peter win out in the end? Or will the terrorists get the upper hand? Find out in this highly intense original movie that is the standard of all spy movies. And unite for a hero that will live on as the ultimate spy reconnoiter since the advent of James Bond.

  * "Warrior" (2011) ) stars Frank Grillo, Kevin Dunn, Tom Hardy. Warrior tells the story of an American soldier named MacArthur who returns from World War II to his wife and children in Okinawa, Japan. MacArthur faces many challenges upon his return to Okinawa including a lack of support for returning veterans, a lack of resources and infrastructure in Okinawa, and a lack of understanding and appreciation for the cultural heritage and traditions of Okinawa among both Japanese and international communities. MacArthur also faces personal challenges and setbacks upon his return to Okinawa including feelings of isolation, disconnection, and estrangement from his family and loved ones, and struggles with mental health issues such as depression and anxiety, and difficulties navigating and managing the complex and ever-evolving legal and regulatory frameworks governing the operation of businesses, organizations, and institutions in both Japan and internationally.

Based on the user's preference cues, here are some potential recommendations:

  * The Pianist (2002): A six-year-old Inuit boy runs off a snowy roof in Copenhagen and dies. Smilla, a half Inuit who lives in the building and knows the boy, looks into it. What makes an acrophobic boy run up on the roof? The clues take her to Greenland.
  * Smilla' s Sense of Snow (1997): A six-year-old Inuit boy runs off a snowy roof in Copenhagen and dies. Smilla, a half Inuit who lives in the building and knows the boy, looks into it. What makes an acrophobic boy run up on the roof? The clues take her to Greenland.
  * The Deer Hunter (1978): An in-depth examination of the ways in which the Vietnam War impacts and disrupts the lives of several friends in a small steel mill town in Pennsylvania.

  * Kundun (1997): From childhood to adulthood, Tibet' s fourteenth Dalai Lama deals with Chinese oppression and other problems.
